name: Clin T
title: Clinical T
notes:
**Note 1:**  The bones of the lateral wall of the nasal cavity include the maxilla, the perpendicular plate of the palatine bone, the medial pterygoid plate, the labyrinth and inferior concha of the ethmoid. The roof of the nasal cavity is formed by the nasal bone. The floor of the nasal cavity, which forms the roof of the mouth, is composed of the bones of the hard palate: the horizontal plate of the palatine bone posteriorly and the palatine process of the maxilla anteriorly.

**Note 2:**  "Bony invasion" does not include extension to palate, cribriform plate, or pterygoid plates.  Extension to these structures is coded separately.

**Note 3:**  Assign T3 for Base of Skull, NOS when there is no information available for more specific bony structures in the skull.

**Note 4:**  Minimal extension to anterior cranial fossa implies tumor pushing through the cribriform plate, but without invasion of the dura or brain.
rows:
Tumor restricted to one subsite of nasal cavity or ethmoid sinus, with or without
bony invasion

Invasive tumor confined to one of the following subsites:
    Septum
    Floor
    Lateral wall, including: 
        Meatus (superior, middle, inferior) 
        Nasal conchae (superior, middle, inferior)
    Vestibule (edge of naris to mucocutaneous junction)
WITH or WITHOUT bony invasion

Confined to nasal cavity, NOS
Localized, NOS

Stated as T1

Tumor involves two subsites in a single site or extends to involve an adjacent site
within the nasoethmoidal complex, with or without bony invasion

Invasive tumor confined to two or more subsites listed in T1 WITH or
WITHOUT bony invasion

Extending to adjacent region within the nasoethmoidal complex:
    Nasolacrimal duct
    Ethmoid sinus
    Choana
WITH or WITHOUT bony invasion

Stated as T2

Tumor extends to invade the medial wall or floor of the orbit, maxillary sinus, 
palate, or cribriform plate.

Adjacent organs/structures including:
    Base of skull, NOS
    Hard palate

Cribiform plate
Maxillary sinus
Medial wall or floor of the orbit

Stated as T3

Tumor invades any of the following:
Anterior orbital contents
Skin of nose or cheek
Minimal extension to anterior cranial fossa
Pterygoid plates
Sphenoid or frontal sinuses

Frontal sinus
Pterygoid plates

Anterior orbital contents
Frontal sinus
Pterygoid plates
Skin of nose
Skin of cheek
Anterior cranial fossa (minimal extension)
Sphenoid sinus

Stated as T4a

Tumor invades any of the following:
Orbital apex
Dura
Brain
Middle cranial fossa
Cranial nerves other than maxillary division of trigeminal nerve (V2)
Nasopharynx
Clivus

Further contiguous extension including:
    Orbital apex 

Stated as T4b

Unknown; extension not stated
Not documented in patient record
